page.title: 03Fairfield,Buxton:Recreation.
page.content: {Fairfield Golf Course }is one of the highest golf courses in England. It is situated on the historic Fairfield Common and enjoys extensive views across the town of Buxton and the surrounding Peak District countryside. There is a large clubhouse on Waterswallows Road. {Fairfield Centre }was built in 1969. It is to be found in the large housing estate which adjoins Victoria Park Road. There are 5 full time staff and 25 part-time staff. Last year 6000 people used the Centre. Most sports are catered for at the Centre, which has had visitors from as far away as Spain. The Centre has an Art Room and a Woodwork Room.Some of the sports which are played there include tennis, badminton, squash, football, netball, basketball, cricket, rugby and roller skating.
